title.narrative: Promoting Sustainable Partnerships for Economic Transformation (PROSPECTS) II

description.narrative: PROSPECTS II will build on learning from a one-year initial project in partnership with Sida. The program will scale-up promising strategies such as apprenticeships and business skills training combined with start-up grants for youth-led businesses; methodological refinement of other components such as the psychosocial interventions with vulnerable youth, who are largely uneducated and unskilled; and the addition of new activities to respond to gaps and opportunities that have arisen, such as mobile phone-based interventions and activities to influence policies on youth employment and skills development. The second phase of the program will create system-level change in the youth employment sector by changing the way that youth are connected to opportunities for training, employment and self-employment. Mercy Corps will also integrate a strong learning component to understand issues underlying youth unemployment, training needs and the school-to-work transition to develop strategies that directly address these challenges.

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
